Package model

Interface Subject

All Known Implementing Classes:
NotesModel
public interface Subject
The Subject interface is a fundamental part of the Observer design pattern. It outlines the methods for adding and removing Observer objects, as well as notifying them of any changes. Classes that implement this interface can have multiple Observer instances that monitor changes in the implementing class's state.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    attach(Observer o)
    Registers an Observer to the subject.
    void
    detach(Observer o)
    Unregisters an Observer from the subject.
    void
    notifyObservers()
    Notifies all registered Observers about a change in the subject's state.

  • Method Details

    • attach

      void attach(Observer o)
      Registers an Observer to the subject. Once attached, the observer will be updated about any changes to the subject's state.
      Parameters:
      o - the Observer to be attached; should not be null

    • detach

      void detach(Observer o)
      Unregisters an Observer from the subject. After being detached, the observer will no longer be updated about changes to the subject's state.
      Parameters:
      o - the Observer to be detached; should not be null

    • notifyObservers

      void notifyObservers()
      Notifies all registered Observers about a change in the subject's state. This method is typically invoked when the subject undergoes a change that observers should be made aware of.
